description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**General English (II)**

**Instructor:** **蘇席瑤** **Hsi-Yao Su**

**E-mail: hsysu@ntnu.edu.tw**

**Office: Cheng (****誠****) 718**

**Office hours: Wednesday: 10:30 am-12:30 pm, Fridays: 1 pm—3 pm**

*   **Course Description:**

This course aims to improve students’ English proficiency by providing them with intensive training in four skills. It includes a variety of classroom activities designed to expose them to a wide range of real-life issues, improve their communication skills in English, and enhance their critical and creative thinking. Students will also gain abundant experience in working with their classmates. As a requirement of this course, students will also work on a project, which will enable them to apply their English skills and showcase their creativity.

*   **Course Objectives:**

This course aims to (1) develop students’ four skills in English; (2) improve their knowledge of vocabulary and grammar in English; (3) build their confidence in speaking English; (4) enhance their learning motivation; (5) foster their cultural knowledge and intercultural competence.

*   **Delivery of instruction:**

Lectures, class activities, QT group discussions, & student presentations.

*   **Textbook:**

Daise, D., & Norloff, C. (2015). _Q: Skills for success–Reading and writing (Book 4)._ New York, NY: Cambridge University Press.

*   **Grading Policy & Course Requirements:**

**1.     Grading Policy:**

   (1) Attendance/participation: 15%

   (2) Assignments & Quizzes: 25%

   (3) Self-learning: 10%

   (4) Midterm project: 20%

   (5) Final project: 20%

   (6) Lexile Test: 10%

**2.    Course requirements**

(1) Attendance and participation

Class attendance and participation is a fundamental requirement in this course. Unexcused absences will result in a failing grade.

(2) Quizzes and assignments

Quizzes will be conducted in class. Quiz dates will be announced beforehand. If students miss any of the quizzes, no make-up quizzes will be given. Students are required to submit any of their assignments (including reports and projects) before it is due. Late assignments will be marked down by **a letter grade (e.g. A ->** **B).** Once they are three or more days late, they will NOT be accepted.

**(3) Self-learning** 

Students are required to complete at least 10 hours of self-learning. Some suggested sources:  
1\. 樸101 自學教室

2\. quizlet.com

3\. [www.iqonlinepractice.com](http://www.iqonlinepractice.com)

4\. Other online resources  
  
Please keep a record of your self-learning activities and turn it in at the end of the semester.

(4) Mid-Term Project: 3-minute presentation

 Use 1 slide to give a 3-minute presentation.

**(5) Final Presentation: Videos**

Make a video (3-5 minutes) on any topic in which you are interested.

**(6) Lexile Test**

The Lexile Test is a required English proficiency test for all students enrolled in freshman English classes. Students will be informed of when and where they should go to take this test.

         Note: _plagiarism_ of any form is strictly prohibited and results in a failing grade.
